body_content.explanation: abbreviation for ultra-high definition: used to describe or refer to a system for showing extremely clear pictures on a television or computer screen:
examples: The PC has a UHD 4K display with a broad colour gamut, making it a great home entertainment system.
TVs with 4K resolution, also known as UHD TVs, have four times as many pixels as standard 1080p resolution TVs.
Planet Earth was streamed in UHD and HDR on supported devices.
